div.bibl: DIE FACKEL, (Chicagoer Arbeiter Zeitung,)Sunday, March 26th, 1882. The Handicrafts of Chicago

body.p: are already now to the greater part dominated by Germans. People who know, think that in the space of ten years it will be exclusively in the hands of our countrymen, after a few thousand Americans, who learned their trade about twenty-five years ago in the Best, have more or less passed away. Cabinet-makers, gold and silverworkers, tailors, shoemakers, bakers and brewers chiefly are Germans and the whole retail business out side the loop is in German hands.
